intro: Ileostylus, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange to red flowers. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Ileostylus thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and disturbed soils. It is also a popular choice for gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
